title: Ticket #7352: Add DAGMan inline submit descriptions
description:
DAGMan currently requires users to provide external submit files to describe jobs in their workflows. We'd like to extend the DAGMan syntax so that submit descriptions can be included inline.

The first step will be modifying the JOB command. Our current syntax expects the user to provide the path to a submit file in the local file system. We'll change this so a user can optionally provide a submit description in an inline classad, preceded by the SUBMIT keyword. For example, to define a job which sleeps for 10 seconds: 

JOB Sleep SUBMIT-DESCRIPTION {
    executable = "/bin/sleep"
    arguments = 10
}

We also need to provide backwards compatibility. So the following syntax will still be valid: 

JOB Sleep sleep.sub

To avoid confusion between submit files and submit descriptions, we'll allow users to reference submit files with an optional FILE keyword: 

JOB Sleep FILE sleep.sub

Lastly, we'll allow submit descriptions to be declared independently of jobs. They can then be associated to jobs by passing the name instead of a classad. For example: 

SUBMIT-DESCRIPTION SleepSubmitDesc = {
    executable = "/bin/sleep"
    arguments = 10
}
JOB Sleep1 SUBMIT-DESCRIPTION SleepSubmitDesc
JOB Sleep2 SUBMIT-DESCRIPTION SleepSubmitDesc

Internally, we'll extend DAGMan's Job() class to store the description in a SubmitHash member variable called _submitDescription. At parse time, condor_dagman will translate the inline classad to a SubmitHash object which can later be handed off directly to the schedd.

Some other rules and assumptions:

  • We will not support clusters with multiple procs. All inline submits are assumed to be "queue 1".
  • The DAGMAN_USE_CONDOR_SUBMIT configuration knob must be set to False. If not condor_dagman will fail at parse time.
  • Inline submits can coexist with regular submit files in the same .dag file.
